awd_titl_txt: Transient Behavior and Stability of Thermoelastic Contact
awd_abstract_narration: When two elastic bodies of different temperature are pressed                    together the resultant heat flux causes distortions and changes                 in the contact area.  Recent work has shown that this situation                 may not be stable but under suitable conditions self-sustaining                 oscillations may be generated.  Perturbation techniques will be                 used in an analytical study of this oscillation phenomenon to                   probe the stability boundary and transient behavior at onset of                 instability.  Materials combinations will be classified according               to their qualitative stability behavior.//
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

inst.inst_name: Regents of the University of Michigan - Ann Arbor
